Navigation
Name Test/Libraries/List/index
Synopsis A list of legal index values of a list.
Function list[int] index(list[&T] lst)
Usage import List;
Description Returns a list of all legal index values for a given list lst. See domain for a function that returns a set of legal index values.
Examples 
rascal>import List;
ok
rascal>index([1, 3, 5]);
list[int]: [0,1,2]
rascal>index(["zebra", "elephant", "snake", "owl"]);
list[int]: [0,1,2,3]
Compare with the result of domain: 
rascal>domain([1, 3, 5]);
set[int]: {2,1,0}
rascal>domain(["zebra", "elephant", "snake", "owl"]);
set[int]: {3,2,1,0}
Benefits This function is useful in unknown: Test:For loops over lists.

Questions
Question [1]. The number of elements in the index of a list is:




Question [2].
The type of index([0, -3, 2, -5, 0]) is

Question [3]. 
index([-7]) ==
